dialog: Hi Medi, I am experiencing stiffness and pain in my knee. What should I do?
Hello, based on your symptoms, you may have knee osteoarthritis. Have you tried transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation yet?
No, I haven’t. How does it work?
TENS delivers a small electrical current to the affected area. It can block pain signals and reduce sensitivity to pain. Would you like to try?
I am not sure, Medi. Is there any other option?
Yes, you can try low level laser therapy. It can relieve pain and stiffness. But there is tentative evidence of benefit. Would you like more information?
Yes, please tell me more about it.

LLLT involves applying low-power light to the affected area. It can stimulate tissue regeneration and reduce inflammation. But it is not FDA approved for the treatment of arthritis. PEMF therapy is another option for you.
What is PEMF therapy?

dialog: Hi Medi, I recently had a knee replacement surgery. Do you have any advice for my recovery?
Of course. What do you want to know?
What type of exercises can I do to improve my knee strength?
You can try simple exercises such as walking, cycling, and swimming. However, you should avoid high-impact exercises like running and jumping.
What about my diet? Are there any foods that I should avoid?
You should avoid processed foods, sugary drinks, and foods high in salt. Instead, you should focus on eating a balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Is there anything else I should do to speed up my recovery?
You should avoid sitting for long periods and try to move around as much as possible. You can also use ice packs to reduce swelling and pain.
Thanks for the advice. When can I return to my normal activities?
knowledge: Arthritis Arthritis Knee replacement surgery is a common treatment option for people with severe knee arthritis. Recovery from knee replacement surgery can take several months, and rehabilitation is an important part of the process. Simple exercises such as walking, cycling, and swimming can help improve knee strength. You should avoid high-impact exercises like running and jumping. A balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains can also help with recovery. You should avoid sitting for long periods and try to move around as much as possible. Ice packs can help reduce swelling and pain. Avoiding repetitive motions, using proper posture, and using assistive devices when necessary can help protect your joints.
Great, thank you for the helpful information. That's all I wanted to ask.
knowledge: Arthritis Arthritis Further research is required to determine if transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation for knee osteoarthritis is effective for controlling pain. Low level laser therapy may be considered for relief of pain and stiffness associated with arthritis. Evidence of benefit is tentative. Pulsed electromagnetic field therapy has tentative evidence supporting improved functioning but no evidence of improved pain in osteoarthritis. The FDA has not approved PEMFT for the treatment of arthritis. In Canada, PEMF devices are legally licensed by Health Canada for the treatment of pain associated with arthritic conditions. Arthritis is predominantly a disease of the elderly, but children can also be affected by the disease Arthritis Arthritis

dialog: Hi Medi, I just had knee replacement surgery. What should I do to aid in my recovery?
Congratulations on your surgery. Rest and physical therapy are important for a successful recovery after knee replacement surgery.
What kind of physical therapy is recommended?
Exercises that focus on improving range of motion, strength, and flexibility are recommended for post-surgery recovery.
How long does recovery usually take?
Recovery time can vary, but it usually takes a few months to a year to fully recover from knee replacement surgery.
What about my diet? Are there any foods I should avoid?
It's important to maintain a healthy diet that includes protein, vitamins, and minerals. Avoiding processed and sugary foods can also help with recovery.

dialog: Hello Medi, what is osteoarthritis?
Osteoarthritis is the most common form of arthritis.
What causes it?
It is caused by the breakdown of cartilage in the joints.
Can it be cured?
Unfortunately, there is no cure for osteoarthritis.
What can I do to manage the symptoms?
There are several things you can do, such as exercise, maintain a healthy weight, and use pain relievers when necessary.
Thank you, Medi. Is there anything else I should know about osteoarthritis?

knowledge: Knee Replacement Knee Replacement The goal of knee replacement surgery is to reduce knee pain and improve knee function.  The surgery involves removing the damaged part of the knee joint and replacing it with an artificial joint.  After surgery, physical therapy and exercise are important to help you regain strength and mobility.  It is important to avoid high-impact activities that put stress on your new knee.  A healthy diet with plenty of protein and nutrients will also help with your recovery. Knee Replacement Knee Replacement
